info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:44AM CDT until June 07 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR JOHNSTON...SOUTHERN COAL...SOUTHERN PONTOTOC...SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA AND EASTERN MURRAY COUNTIES... At 842 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles west of Stonewall to 3 miles northwest of Pontotoc to near Mill Creek, moving southeast at 60 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR Mill Creek, Pontotoc, and Connerville. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Ada, Sulphur, Atoka, Tishomingo, Coalgate, Roff, Ravia, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Lehigh, Tupelo, Mill Creek, Milburn, Fitzhugh, Bromide, Centrahoma, Hickory, Clarita, Olney and Fillmore. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
